title: TCS buyback: TCS board approves Rs 16,000 crore buyback at Rs 2,850/share
text:
NEW DELHI: The board of directors of IT giant TCS on Monday approved a proposal to buy back up to 5.61 per cent equity shares at a price not exceeding Rs 2,850, aggregating to Rs 16,000 crore. 

In a filing to BSE, the company said, “the board has approved buyback of 5,61,40,351 equity shares for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs 16,000 crore (hereinafter referred to as the buyback size) being 2.85 per cent of the total paidup equity share capital, at Rs 2,850.” 

The announcement came at a time when Indian IT companies are under pressure to share profits with shareholders. 

Media reports have been buzzing for some time about a host of cash-rich IT companies considering share buybacks to retain shareholder interest amid lacklustre show by the stocks and their businesses. TCS has Rs 43,100 crore cash on its book, which is roughly 10 per cent of its market capitalisation. 

“The share buyback is proposed to be made from the shareholders of the company on a proportionate basis under the tender offer route using the stock exchange mechanism in accordance with the provisions contained in the SEBI (Buy Back of Securities) Regulations , 1998 and the Companies Act, 2013 and rules made thereunder,” the company said. 

The buyback size does not include any expenses incurred or to be incurred for the buyback like filing fees, advisory fees, public announcement publication expenses, printing and dispatch expenses and other incidental and related expenses, the company said. 

“The buyback is subject to shareholder approval by way of a special resolution through postal ballot. The public announcement setting out the process, time lines and other requisite details will be released in due course in accordance with the buyback regulations,” the company said. 

The company had last Thursday informed stock exchanges about the board meeting, which was held on Monday. 

Reacting to the news, the company's shares rallied over 4 per cent to settle the day at Rs 2,506 on BSE.
